sentence.content: The Oscar statuette, one of the most recognizable images in the entertainment world, has no copyright protection, a federal judge has ruled.

sentence.content: Although Waters acknowledged that the Creative House trophy is ``very similar&apost;&apost; to the Oscar, he rejected all of the academy&apost;s legal claims, saying that the statuette became part of the public domain prior to Jan. 1, 1978, the effective date of the Copyright Act of 1976.

sentence.content: ``We are surprised that the court would base its decision on events which occurred half a century ago, overlooking the meticulous fashion in which the Academy has protected the integrity of its institutional symbol for decades,&apost;&apost; Malden said in a statement.
